Package com.xm.cryptorecservice.service

Class CryptoRecService

java.lang.Object
com.xm.cryptorecservice.service.CryptoRecService
@Service public class CryptoRecService extends Object
Service layer class that supports the operations of CryptoRecController. Interfaces with a DatabaseConnection instance and an InMemoryAggregateStats instance to achieve its goals.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getAggregateStats

      public Map<String,CryptoPriceStats> getAggregateStats()
      Get the aggregate stats for all cryptos.
      Returns:
      A Map keyed by crypto name, and instances of CryptoPriceStats as values.

    • cryptoSupported

      public boolean cryptoSupported(String cryptoName)
      Queries the in-memory DB (which the app keeps in sync with the on-disk DB) for the support of a particular cryptocurrency.
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The name of the crypto to ask our support of.
      Returns:
      true if the cryptocurrency is supported by the application, false otherwise.

    • getAggregateStatsOfCrypto

      public CryptoPriceStats getAggregateStatsOfCrypto(String cryptoName)
      Retrieves the aggregate stats (minimum, maximum, first, last price, price difference, range and normalized price) of the provided cryptocurrency.
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The crypto to retrieve the aggregate stats of.
      Returns:
      An instance of CryptoPriceStats if the crypto is supported, null otherwise.

    • getCryptosSortedByNormalizedPrice

      public SortedMap<String,BigDecimal> getCryptosSortedByNormalizedPrice(SortOrder sortOrder)
      Retrieve the cryptos in sorted order of normalized price.
      Parameters:
      sortOrder - A SortOrder instance that specifies if we want the order to be ascending or descending.
      Returns:
      A SortedMap with crypto names as keys and normalized prices as values, where the keys are sorted by values according to the provided sort order.

    • getBestCryptoForDate

      public Map.Entry<String,BigDecimal> getBestCryptoForDate(String date)
      Retrieve the " best scoring " crypto for the provided date (in YYYY-mm-dd format), or null if no data existed for any crypto for that date. The best-scoring crypto for a given date is defined as the one with the greatest normalized price for the given date.
      Parameters:
      date - A date in YYYY-mm-dd format.
      Returns:
      A Map.Entry with the crypto name as key and the normalized daily price as value, or null if there was no date for any crypto for the provided date.
